result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean L. Plaski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

Defendant Sean L. Plaski in court with attorney Gregory J. Jerabek. Defendant Sean L. Plaski in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 12CF-466, 13CF-433, 13CF-470, 14CF-175, and 14CF-176.

3:10 PM Court calls cases.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

This is the date and time set for a sentencing.
Court received a copy of the PSI.
Copies of the PSI were sent to the parties.
State received their copy. State has no proposed corrections or amendments.
Atty Jerabek received a copy as well, has no proposed corrections or amendments.

Both victims are present, one wishes to make a statement.
Defense only wishes to state an argument.
State has complied with victim notification statutes.
State presents a copy of the victim impact statement that will be read and provides a copy to the reporter.

3:12 PM Karissa Plaski-Friday addresses the Court. 

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court prior to sentencing, states the recommendations:
12CF-466  Ct 1: whld sent, 36 mo prob, 90 days jail, obt/mtn empt, domest abs alt prog, other counseling, dna sample, pay costs, dna surcharge, domest abs sucharge,no contact with Karissa Plaski Friday.
13CF-433 Ct 1 and Ct 4: whld sent, 36 mo prob, 90 days jail concurrent to each other but consecutive to 12CF-466, same conditions, no contact with Tabitha Plaski unless agent has approved contact. Tabitha has requested contact. Ct costs on both counts, pay dna surcharge on each count
13CF-470 Ct 1 and Ct 2 and Ct 3: wthld sent, 36 mo prob on felony count, 90 days jail concurrent to each other but consecutive to other files
14CF-175 Ct 4: whld sent, 36 mo prob, 90 day jail consecutive to other files, ct costs, dna surcharge, domestic abuse surcharge
14CF-176 Ct 4: whld sent, 36 mo prob, no additional jail time, same conditions

State requests bonds posted in the files to be applied to fines and costs.

Atty Jerabek addresses the Court prior to sentencing, 180 days jail credit.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

12CF-466:
Count 1:
Determinate Prison Sentence for 4 1/2 Years
30 Months initial confinement
24 Months extended supervision
Imposed and Stayed
Probation for a period of 36 Months
Conditions:
Jail sentence for 90 Days
Maintain full time employment
Retake, complete and pay for the Domestic Abuse Alternative Program
Comply with other counseling as recommended by the agent
Submit a DNA Sample
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay domestic abuse surcharge
No contact with Karissa Plaski-Friday
No contact wtih Tabitha Plaski unless agent appoves such contact and safety plan put in place

13CF-433:
Count 1:
Determinate Prison Sentence for 4 1/2 Years
30 Months initial confinement
24 Months extended supervision
Concurrent to 12CF-466
Imposed and Stayed
Probation for a period of 36 Months, concurrent to 12CF-466

Jail sentence of 90 Days consecutive to 12CF-466
Pay domestic abuse surcharge
Pay costs
Pay DNA surcharge

Count 4:

30 Months initial confinement
24 Months extended supervision
Concurrent to Count 1 and 12CF-466
Imposed and Stayed

Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 1 and 12CF-466
Jail sentence of 90 Days, concurrent to Count 1 but consecutive to 12CF-466
Pay court costs
Pay DNA surcharge

13CF-470:

12 Months extended supervision
Concurrent to 12CF-466 and 13CF-433
Imposed and Stayed
Probation for a period of 36 Months, concurrent to 12CF-466 and 13CF-433

Pay domestic abuse surcharge

Count 2:

Concurrent to Count 1 and 12CF-466 and 13CF-433
Imposed and Stayed
Probation for a period of 36 Months, concurrent to Count 1 and 12CF-466 and 13CF-433
Conditions:

Pay costs

Count 3:
Determinate Prison Sentence for 4 1/2 Years
30 Months initial confinement
24 Months extended supervision
Concurrent to Count 1 and Count 2 and 12CF-466 and 13CF-433
Imposed and Stayed
Probation for a period of 36 Months, concurrent to Count 1 and Count 2 and 12CF-466 and 13CF-433
Conditions:

30 Months initial confinement

Probation for a period of 36 Months, concurrent to 12CF-466 and 13CF-433 and 13CF-470 and 14CF-175

***Additionally***
Any bond posted in the files are to be applied to fines and costs

BY THE COURT:
Court orders PSI and orders it be delivered to the parties one week before sentencing hearing.

Atty Barnett requests the Court to reduce bail.
State objects to reduction in bail.

BY THE COURT:
Court will not reduce the bond.
Court will revoke the bond.

Attorneys to get hearing date from judicial assisant.
Plea hearing on June 6, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Gregory J Jerabek in court. David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are: 12CF-466, 13CF-433, 13CF-470, 14CF-175 and 14CF-176.

8:41 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Defendant does not appear but Atty Jerabek appears.
Parties hoped to have done a plea today but Defense atty, because of the jail situation, had been transferred to Waupaca Co Jail.  Defendant was not brought back here to have a plea hearing. Parties are asking the Court to modify the bonds in 14CF-175 and 176 - signature bond with conditions.

There has been victim notification and consultation regarding the bond modification.
Discussions continue regarding bond modifications and the conditions.

Court questions Atty Knaapen about concerns modifying the bond.
Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, states same concerns. 
Atty Jerabek addresses the Court. 

Court has no confidence the Defendant will honor conditions.

BY THE COURT:
Court will not modify the bonds.

Plea hearing can be scheduled sooner, PSI will be anticipated. 
Br 1 will get consent from Br 2 to do the plea hearing on Friday.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 6, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on June 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sean L. Plaski in court with attorney Gregory J Jerabek. Defendant Sean L. Plaski in custody. David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases 14CF175 and 14CF176 are heard today for preliminary hearing on each case.
Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
  Arraignment on both cases 14CF175 and 14CF176:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Not Guilty Plea entered.
Bond Continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Bond Continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

ADA David Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jumping.
Court advises defendant of right to remain silent, right to make statement. 
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Atty Knaapen recommends a $5,000 cash bond on this file with conditions as stated. 
Court questions the defendant.
Defendant makes statements to the Court.
